title-part.text: TESTING STATIC OR DYNAMIC BALANCE OF MACHINES OR STRUCTURES
TESTING OF STRUCTURES OR APPARATUS, NOT OTHERWISE PROVIDED FOR

note.note-paragraph: Attention is drawn to the Note following the title of Class G01.

The following IPC groups are not in the CPC scheme. The subject matter for these IPC groups is classified in the following CPC groups:
G01M1/38 covered by G01M1/14 and G01M1/30 and subgroups
In this subclass non-limiting references (in the sense of paragraph 39 of the Guide to the IPC) may still be displayed in the scheme.

title-part.text: Testing static or dynamic balance of machines or structures
Details of balancing machines or devices
Adaptation of bearing support assemblies for receiving the body to be tested

CPC-specific-text.text: the body being a vehicle wheel

title-part.text: Adaptation of drive assemblies for receiving the body to be tested
Instruments for indicating directly the magnitude and phase of the unbalance
Determining position of centre of gravity

CPC-specific-text.text: Determining position of centre of gravity

title-part.text: by oscillating or rotating the body to be tested
and running the body down from a speed greater than normal
and applying external forces compensating forces due to unbalance
and converting vibrations due to unbalance into electric variables
Performing balancing on elastic shafts, e.g. for crankshafts
with special adaptations for marking, e.g. by drilling
with special adaptations for determining unbalance of the body in situ, e.g. of vehicle wheels
by adding material to the body to be tested, e.g. by correcting-weights

CPC-specific-text.text: the body being a vehicle wheel

title-part.text: by removing material from the body to be tested, e.g. from the tread of tyres
by adjusting position of masses built-in the body to be tested

CPC-specific-text.text: Test plugs for closing off the end of a pipe
Details with respect to the testing of engines or engine parts
Details with respect to the testing of elastic elements, e.g. gloves, condoms

title-part.text: by detecting the presence of fluid at the leakage point

CPC-specific-text.text: by using materials which expand, contract, disintegrate, or decompose in contact with a fluid
with photo-electrical detection means, e.g. using optical fibres

title-part.text: by observing bubbles in a liquid pool
by observing elastic covers or coatings, e.g. soapy water

CPC-specific-text.text: for welds; for containers, e.g. radiators

reference.text: G01M3/06, G01M3/12, G01M3/20, G01M3/24, G01M3/26 take precedence

CPC-specific-text.text: by means of cables or similar elongated devices, e.g. tapes
for welds; for containers, e.g. radiators

title-part.text: using special tracer materials, e.g. dye, fluorescent material, radioactive material

CPC-specific-text.text: Accessories or associated equipment; Pump constructions
for welds; for containers, e.g. radiators
removably mounted in a test cell

title-part.text: using infrasonic, sonic, or ultrasonic vibrations

CPC-specific-text.text: using pigs or probes travelling in the pipe

title-part.text: by measuring rate of loss or gain of fluid, e.g. by pressure-responsive devices, by flow detectors

CPC-specific-text.text: using pigs or moles traveling in the pipe
for pipe sections by testing its exterior surface
for seals not incorporated in a pipe joint

title-part.text: using progressive displacement of one fluid by another

CPC-specific-text.text: by monitoring the interior space of the containers
for verifying the internal pressure of closed containers
removably mounted in a test cell
for verifying the internal pressure of closed containers

title-part.text: by testing the possibility of maintaining the vacuum in containers, e.g. in can-testing machines
by detecting change in dimensions of the structure being tested

CPC-specific-text.text: the structure being removably mounted in a test cell
by isolating only a part of the structure being tested

title-part.text: by using electric means, e.g. by observing electric discharges
Investigating the elasticity of structures, e.g. deflection of bridges or air-craft wings

CPC-specific-text.text: of elongated objects, e.g. pipes, masts, towers or railways
by determining damage, crack or wear
by means of external apparatus, e.g. test benches or portable test systems
of elongated objects, e.g. pipes, masts, towers or railways
by exciting or detecting vibration or acceleration
by means of external apparatus, e.g. test benches or portable test systems
by measuring variation of impedance, e.g. resistance, capacitance, induction
by using electromagnetic excitation or detection
by means of a shake table
Vibration control arrangements, e.g. for generating random vibrations
Specimen mounting arrangements, e.g. table head adapters

title-part.text: Arrangements in or on wind tunnels
Measuring arrangements specially adapted for aerodynamic testing

CPC-specific-text.text: Wind tunnel balances; Holding devices combined with measuring arrangements

title-part.text: Arrangements in or on ship-testing tanks or water tunnels
Testing structures by optical methods not otherwise provided for

CPC-specific-text.text: Testing of reflective surfaces, e.g. mirrors
Details of devices holding the object to be tested
by determining the optical axis or position of lenses
by measuring multiple properties of lenses, automatic lens meters
by measuring geometrical properties or aberrations
by determining the shape of the object to be tested

reference.text: measuring contours or curvatures by optical means G01B11/24

CPC-specific-text.text: by analyzing the image formed by the object to be tested
by using targets or reference patterns
Detecting defects of the object to be tested, e.g. scratches or dust

reference.text: investigating the presence of flaws or contamination on materials by optical means G01N21/88

CPC-specific-text.text: by measuring material or chromatic transmission properties
of objectives by measuring the optical modulation transfer function

title-part.text: Testing the alignment of vehicle headlight devices

CPC-specific-text.text: Details of the mechanical construction of the light measuring system
using an indicator mounted on the head-light
by using camera or other imaging system for the light analysis
Details of the vehicle positioning system, e.g. by using a laser
with part of the measurements done from inside the vehicle
by using a contact-less detection method, i.e. with a camera
by using an optical fiber in contact with the device under test [DUT]
the optical fiber being on or near the surface of the DUT
Details about the embedment of the optical fiber within the DUT
of optical fibres; Mechanical features associated with the optical testing of optical fibres
Testing of optical devices, constituted by fibre optics or optical waveguides
with a light emitter and a light receiver being disposed at the same side of a fibre or waveguide end-face, e.g. reflectometers
Reflectometers detecting the back-scattered light in the time-domain, e.g. OTDR
using multiple or wavelength variable input source
Details of the optoelectronics or data analysis
Details of the opto-mechanical connection, e.g. connector or repeater
Reflectometers detecting the back-scattered light in the frequency-domain, e.g. OFDR, FMCW, heterodyne detection
Reflectometers using stimulated back-scatter, e.g. Raman or fibre amplifiers
with a light emitter being disposed at one fibre or waveguide end-face, and a light receiver at the other end-face
using two or more input wavelengths
by measuring dispersion other than PMD, e.g. chromatic dispersion
in which light is transversely coupled into or out of the fibre or waveguide, e.g. using integrating spheres
in which light is projected perpendicularly to the axis of the fibre or waveguide for monitoring a section thereof
in which light is projected from both sides of the fiber or waveguide end-face

note.note-paragraph:
Group G01M13/00 is impacted by reclassification into group G01M13/003.
Groups G01M13/00 and G01M13/003 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

reference.text: testing valves for fluid tightness G01M3/00

note.note-paragraph:
Group G01M13/003 is incomplete pending reclassification of documents from group G01M13/00.
Groups G01M13/00 and G01M13/003 should be considered in order to perform a complete search.

title-part.text: Power-transmitting endless elements, e.g. belts or chains
Test-benches with rotational drive means and loading means
Test-benches of the mechanical closed-loop type, i.e. having a gear system constituting a closed-loop in combination with the object under test
Test-benches with force-applying means, e.g. loading of drive shafts along several directions
Details or accessories of testing apparatus

note.note-paragraph: Group G01M15/05 takes precedence over groups G01M15/042 and G01M15/06 - G01M15/12.

CPC-specific-text.text: by monitoring a single specific parameter not covered by groups G01M15/06 - G01M15/12
by monitoring power, e.g. by operating the engine with one of the ignitions interrupted; by using acceleration tests

title-part.text: by combined monitoring of two or more different engine parameters
by monitoring positions of pistons or cranks
by monitoring pressure in fluid ducts, e.g. in lubrication or cooling parts
Testing gas-turbine engines or jet-propulsion engines

reference.text: testing fluid tightness G01M3/00; testing elastic properties of bodies or chassis, e.g. torsion-testing, G01M5/00; testing alignment of vehicle headlight devices G01M11/06; testing of engines G01M15/00

CPC-specific-text.text: the wheels of the vehicle co-operating with rotatable rolls
Details, e.g. roller construction, vehicle restraining devices
the tyre co-operating with rotatable rolls
combined with tyre surface correcting or marking means
using infrasonic, sonic or ultrasonic vibrations
using light, e.g. infra-red, ultra-violet or holographic techniques
the vehicle wheels co-operating with rotatable rollers
the vehicle wheels co-operating with rotatable rolls

title-part.text: Subject matter not provided for in other groups of this subclass

CPC-specific-text.text: Testing of furniture, e.g. seats or mattresses
Testing the effects of speed or acceleration
Testing of complete machines, e.g. washing-machines or mobile phones

reference.text: testing of machine parts G01M13/00; testing of electric apparatus or components G01R31/50

note.note-paragraph: This group covers mechanical testing of complete machines

CPC-specific-text.text: by applying a load, e.g. for resistance or wear testing

reference.text: G01M99/001 takes precedence; testing the elasticity of structures G01M5/00
